intro: Ardisia furfuracella subsp. veraguasensis, commonly known as the Veraguas pimento, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in regions of Panama and Costa Rica. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy, dark green leaves and produces clusters of small, white flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded forest understories, thriving in humid tropical environments. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns red when mature, attracting various bird species.
